definition: stinking reputation/notorious far and wide
stench/smelly/to smell (bad)/repulsive/loathsome/terrible/bad/severely/ruthlessly/dud (ammunition)
sense of smell/smell bad
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
to distance oneself from (classical)
far/distant/remote/(intensifier in a comparison) by far/much (lower etc)
abbr. for 揚州|扬州[Yang2 zhou1]/surname Yang
to raise/to hoist/the action of tossing or winnowing/scattering (in the wind)/to flutter/to propagate
variant of 揚|扬[yang2]

sentences.english: Some small traders at this tourist spot are notorious for their overcharging customers.
sentences.chinese: 这个旅游景点的一些小商贩以宰客而臭名远扬。

sentences.english: That wizened and grotesque little old man is a notorious miser.
sentences.chinese: 那个干瘪难看的小老头是个臭名远扬的吝啬鬼。

sentences.english: But the novelty of being famous for being bad was wearing off, and even now.
sentences.chinese: 但臭名远扬的新奇感逐渐消失了，即便是现在。

sentences.english: China is notorious for its algae blooms.
sentences.chinese: 中国藻华泛滥早已“臭名远扬”。

definition: notorious/infamous/egregious (bandits)
to be thoroughly discredited/to fall into disrepute
to have a bad reputation
bad name/evil reputation
notorious for his misdeeds (idiom)/infamous
notorious (idiom)/infamous
to lose one's standing/to have one's reputation swept away/a complete defeat and fall from grace
sb or sth detested by all/target of scorn/anathema/cf. 老鼠過街，人人喊打|老鼠过街，人人喊打[lao3 shu3 guo4 jie1 , ren2 ren2 han3 da3]
to have one's name go down in history as a byword for infamy (idiom)
infamous/notorious
to spit on and curse/to revile
known by everyone (idiom); well known/a household name
lit. people rebelling and friends deserting (idiom)/fig. to find oneself utterly isolated
lit. strung through and filled with evil (idiom); filled with extreme evil/replete with vice/guilty of monstrous crimes
see 盡人皆知|尽人皆知[jin4 ren2 jie1 zhi1]
reputation
